result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges. To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.   Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of pobable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in  any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: per order dated October 17, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1745CR, IT IS ORDERED the certification is granted and the appeal is accepted for consideration of all issues raised before the court of appeals. When this court grants direct review upon certification, it acquires jurisdiction of the case, Wis. Const. art. VII, 3(3), that is, the entire appeal, which includes all issues, not merely the issues certified or the issue for which the court accepts certification. Further, the court has jurisdiction over issues not certified because the court may review an issues directly on its own motion. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within 30 days after the date of this order the appellant must file either a brief in this court of a statement that no brief will be filed; that within 20 days of filing, the respondent must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that is a brief is filed by the respondent, within 10 days of filing, the appellant must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief; instead, any material upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief in this court; and  IT IS FUTHER ORDERED that in the event any part elects not to file a brief in this court, the briefs previously submitted by that party to the court of appeals shall stand as the party's brief in the Supreme Court; and  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within the time period established for the filing briefs, each party must provide the clerk of this court with copies of the briefs previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals. If a party elects to file a new brief(s), 10 copies of their court of appeals brief(s) must be provided. If a party elects to stand on their court of appeals brief(s), 17 copies of each of their court of appeals brief(s) must be provided. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the parties shall be notified of the date and time for oral arguments in this appeal in due course.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Defense memorandum on sentencing received and filed.

Defendant Michael L Cox in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Michael L Cox in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  If defendant has already provided a DNA sample, this condition, along with payment of the related surcharge is waived.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
--Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Michael L Cox in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Michael L Cox in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a read-in on COUNT 1.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to COUNT 1 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Matter adjourned to 1:30 p.m. this date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael L Cox not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mieno via telephone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael L Cox not in court, in custody.  
Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Shelton appears as new counsel; Attorney Morales on leave.  The state awaiting blood results to turn over to defense.  Status date selected with the parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Michael L Cox not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials (blood results) and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael L Cox in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael L Cox in custody.  Ron Dague for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
THIRD MOTION FOR EXTENSION OF TIME TO FILE POST-CONVICTION MOTION OR NOTICE OF APPEAL, FILED

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

CASE RECALLED AT 3:54.  Court waived defendant's appearance.  Same appearances by defense and state.  Court omitted the scram bracelet previously ordered.

Defendant Michael L Cox in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Michael L Cox in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
